title: The Vein: A Corpuscle's Journey
tagline: A runaway and a refugee chase truth across the poisoned veins of postwar America.
themes: The Diaspora of the American Dream

story: Write a scene where a character encounters a community of 'stranded' people (e.g., in a hollowed-out city, a migrant camp, a forgotten town) who have built their own meaning outside the American Dream.
Draft a letter from Leo's younger brother back in Cleveland, revealing the fallout of Leo's departure and his own perspective on their family's 'quiet desperation'.
Create a monologue from the perspective of a minor character met on the road (e.g., the sour-mash man, a jazz musician, a fleeing farmworker) about their own personal exile.
Write a 'lost chapter' set in a location the novel glosses over (e.g., the Vegas stint, the Tijuana episode) focusing on a moment of failed connection or stark revelation.
technical: Build an interactive map tracing Leo and Alma's journey from Cleveland to San Francisco, allowing users to click on locations to read excerpts, see period photos, and hear ambient sounds (bus depots, jazz clubs).

Create a text analysis tool that compares the linguistic style (sentence length, word choice, metaphor density) of Leo's notebook entries against the novel's third-person narration, visualizing the 'beat' vs. 'naturalist' tension.
